title: Angular momentum - airplane performing a roll

content.question: An airplane is performing rolls, which are rotations about the airplane’s central axis, as shown in the figures. In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the airplane is rotating in the counterclockwise direction with an angular speed of <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows the airplane a short time later, when it is rotating in the clockwise direction with an angular speed of <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. If the airplane’s rotational inertia about its central axis is <math alttext="I sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, what is the magnitude of the change in the airplane’s angular momentum between the two moments shown in the figures?
